Key Match Events: Netherlands put a valiant showing with the bat amassing a decent total of 158 for 4 with ex-Proteas player Colin Ackerman scoring 41 of just 26 balls.
The Protea batters fell one after the other with no momentum or belief to hold the bat let alone reach the target.
Pre-Game Insights: The question every Protea fan had at the back of their mind was whether they would make it to the knock-out game.
Post-Match Reflections: The all too familiar feeling of desolation had once again engulfed the South African faithful as a helpless Protea outfit succumbed to a thirteen run defeat.
It has happened way too often be it the 1992, 2003, 2011 and 2015 editions of the ODI World Cup or the episode that serves as the basis of this article.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Adelaide surface was slow but certainly not unplayable.

South Africa had started rather impressively in this mother of T20 tournaments with decimating Zimbabwe before the raingods intervened, a clinical showing against India and a hammering given out to Bangladesh.
Others: The author sincerely hopes at some point South Africa and their fortunes do turn around.
